title: dedup lang engine parse logic
notes: review each language's engine.rs file. Identify logic that is duplicated across all of them and move anything that can reasonably be moved into the src/core logic that's shared across all languages. parser setup is one likely candidate, but there may be others

title: Create agent-specific documentation (AGENT.md)
description: Current docs target humans. Agents need different documentation focused on primitives, schemas, and composition. Create AGENT.md with: common agent workflows (not human workflows), JSON schemas, primitive composition examples, completion signal documentation, machine-readable capability discovery.
design: Write docs from agent perspective. Include example scripts. Auto-generate JSON schemas from code. Low effort, low-medium impact.
acceptance_criteria:
1. Create AGENT.md with agent-focused content
2. Include common agent workflows and examples
3. Document all JSON schemas
4. Provide completion signal documentation
5. Include example agent scripts (Python, shell)
6. Link from main README

title: rename each language's kinds.rs file to mutations.rs
Add machine-readable output formats to all print commands
description: Agents need structured data (JSON/JSONL) to process results programmatically. Add --format flag to all print commands (results, mutants, mutations, targets) supporting json and jsonl formats.
design: Modify src/core/cmds/print.rs to add format parameter. Create serializable output structs. Use serde_json. High impact, low effort.
acceptance_criteria:
1. Add --format flag to all print commands
2. Support json and jsonl formats  
3. JSON output includes all data from human format
4. JSON schema is consistent and documented
5. Default to human-readable for backward compatibility

title: Add introspection commands for discovery and context
description: Agents suffer from context starvation when they can't discover capabilities or inspect state. Add: 'mewt capabilities' (lists languages, mutations), 'mewt status' (campaign progress, DB state), 'mewt describe <id>' (mutant details). All support --format json.
design: Add commands to src/core/cli.rs. capabilities queries LanguageRegistry, status queries DB metadata, describe queries mutant details. May need campaign metadata table. Medium effort, high impact.
acceptance_criteria:
1. mewt capabilities command lists languages and mutations
2. mewt status shows database state and campaign progress
3. mewt describe <mutant-id> shows detailed mutant info
4. All commands support --format json

title: Add dry-run mode to show execution plan
description: Complex config precedence makes it impossible for agents to predict what will execute. Add 'mewt run --dry-run' to preview execution without running tests. Show resolved test command, timeout, mutant count, skip optimization status. Add 'mewt resolve-test-cmd <path>' for just the test command.
design: Leverage config resolution in src/core/types/config.rs. Add dry-run flag to RunArgs. Short-circuit execution in run handler. Low effort, high impact.
acceptance_criteria:
1. mewt run --dry-run shows execution plan without running
2. Output includes test command, timeout, mutant count, skip status
3. mewt resolve-test-cmd <path> shows resolved command
4. Support --format json

title: Add meaningful exit codes and final campaign summary
description: Agents need explicit completion status, not heuristic detection. Add structured status to campaign operations: status (complete/partial/interrupted), progress counts, resumption info, next_mutant_id, time estimates. Include in both human and JSON output.
design: Modify campaign runner in src/core/runner.rs. Add progress tracking. Store metadata in DB. Output summary on completion and interrupt. Medium effort, high impact.
acceptance_criteria:
1. Exit code 0 when all mutants caught
2. Exit code 1 when uncaught mutants found (test gaps exist)  
3. Exit code 2 when interrupted or error
4. Final summary shows: tested, caught, uncaught, skipped
5. Summary in both human and --format json (if we add json)
notes: UPDATED: Focus on exit codes and final summary, not progress during execution (already covered by progress bar). Agents need: meaningful exit codes (0=success, 1=gaps found, 2=error) and final summary counts.

title: Make resumption behavior explicit and controllable
description: Automatic resumption is opaque to agents. Show resumption info at campaign start (resuming from mutant X, progress Y/Z). Add --fresh flag to force clean start. Add --resume-from <id> to resume from specific mutant. Include resumption info in status output.
design: Detect resumption state before starting. Add flags to RunArgs in cli.rs. Clear outcomes when --fresh specified. Display banner before work starts. Low effort, medium-high impact.
acceptance_criteria:
1. Display resumption info at campaign start
2. Add --fresh flag to force clean start
3. Add --resume-from <id> for specific resumption point
4. Include resumption state in status command

title: Support file-based state export and import
description: Database is opaque to agents. Add 'mewt export --output-dir' to dump DB to JSON files (targets/, mutants/, results/, config.json). Add 'mewt import --input-dir' to import from files. Files should be human-readable and agent-parseable with standard tools (cat, grep, jq).
design: Create export/import commands. Design directory structure. Use JSON/JSONL for data. Add validation on import. High effort, high impact - enables file manipulation workflows.
acceptance_criteria:
1. mewt export dumps database to JSON files
2. Export includes targets/, mutants/, results/, config.json
3. mewt import loads state from files
4. Support incremental import (only changed files)
5. Files are both human and agent readable

title: Break down run command into atomic primitives
description: 'mewt run' bundles multiple operations (generate, test, skip logic). Agents need atomic primitives to compose. Ensure 'mewt mutate' only generates. Add 'mewt list-untested' for mutants without outcomes. Add 'mewt should-skip <id>' to query skip logic. Document primitive composition patterns.
design: Audit commands for atomicity. Extract skip logic into queryable function. Add list command variations. Keep run as convenience wrapper. Medium effort, medium impact.
acceptance_criteria:
1. mewt mutate is atomic (only generates)
2. mewt list-untested shows mutants without outcomes
3. mewt should-skip <id> queries skip logic
4. Keep mewt run for human convenience
5. Document primitive composition examples

title: Add rich filtering to all print commands
description: Limited filtering forces agents to post-process output. Add comprehensive filters to all print commands. 'mewt print results' should support --status, --language, --mutation-type, --line, --file. Add --format ids to output just IDs (one per line) for piping to other commands.
design: Add filter params to PrintArgs. Implement in DB queries. Add special --format ids handling. Document filter combinations. Medium effort, medium impact.
acceptance_criteria:
1. print results supports status, language, mutation-type, line, file filters
2. print mutants supports line, file, mutation-type, tested/untested filters
3. Add --format ids for piping workflows
4. All filters composable (AND logic)
5. Filtering in DB queries, not post-processing
notes: ELEVATED: This is the RIGHT way for agents to handle large datasets (potentially tens of thousands of mutants/results). Agents should filter to relevant subset through the tool, not dump everything. Essential for agent usability with large campaigns.
